channel.title: Deltascape Teleport Interface [Break]?

item.title: Deltascape Teleport Interface [Break]?
item.dc:creator: @I_Hawk_I I Hawk I
item.description:
@I_Hawk_I wrote:

This Topic can be used as help for others aswell as solving a small problem for myself.
Alright So I decided to see about making a sort of “More” feature for the Deltascape Teleports Inferface

Ok, the “more” feature merely takes you to a duplicate of the first interface, but containing different Teleports.

I have done all the teleports and interfaces already here is what I did…

case 6004: // Moster Teleport c.sendQuest("Rock crabs", 15240); c.sendQuest("Island", 15241); c.sendQuest("More", 15239); c.sendQuest("Cave", 15243); c.sendQuest("Slayer tower", 15242); c.setSidebarInterface(6, 3209); // magic tab (ancient = 12855) c.interfaceGame = 1;

This is the first interface as shown in the picture, On click the “more” feature takes you to this, unfortunately due to my problem, I cannot show a picture but I can assure you for certain the interface works fine…

case 59135: if(c.interfaceGame == 1) c.sendQuest("Dagg lair", 15240); c.sendQuest("KBD", 15241); c.sendQuest("More", 15239); c.sendQuest("Kalphite Queen", 15243); c.sendQuest("Giant Mole", 15242); c.setSidebarInterface(6, 3209); // magic tab (ancient = 12855) c.interfaceGame = 3;

Now there is another interface that will come after that aswell… but its not necesary for what I need the help with.

The teleports link up fine, so yes as you press the interface button, you are teleport to the necesary place

case 59136: c.triggerTele(3564, 3288, 0); if(c.interfaceGame == 3)

Ok, but!! I was wondering if, or what the code is for a sort of “break” if you will. If you say it has something to do with the Break; at the end of each case. I have already tried adding it in but as predicted, compile errors as the break; needs to be at the end of the case, hence ending the case there, but I have more than just that interface so I cant put a break; after, or it will remove the following from that case therefore causing errors. Well what currently happens, is… as you click the “More” button it will take you to the next interface, but in doing so teleporting you to place that the second interfaces middle button is meant to.
I merely want to know whether there is something I need to add to pause it on the second interface to allow the player to choose out of the buttons on the second interface.
[br][br][size=1]Posted on: August 25, 2009, 01:57:38 pm[/size][br][br][size=1]Posted on: August 25, 2009, 04:53:34 pm[/size][hr]nvm ive fixed anyway, feel free to delete this topic.

Read full topic
